website_summaries.verdict: A rugged, solid built table that offers a spacious work surface once assembled. The best deal for the budget-minded.
pros: Affordable yet built for heavy-duty tasks
Has the ability to easily micro adjust and provides perfectly controlled cuts
cons: Requires sorting of a lot of parts prior to assembly, which is also time consuming and confusing
The fence doesn't move smoothly over the table top, which has a rough finish

customer_reviews.title: Made in CHINA
customer_reviews.text: How hard is it to make a plate that is flat? I mean seriously? Specifically purchased this for the metal top to avoid sagging, but the router plate is warped right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with you Bosch
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice and the power switch completely stopped working. Outside of that, it's just not what you would expect as a Bosch product. The table top was about .004" - .005" out of flat which I wasn't too concerned about because I rarely use the router for precision joinery but the switch going out so soon, this table isn't much more than a Harbor Freight product with fancy badging.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: The warping is so bad if I hold a board along one side of ...
customer_reviews.text: Warped top. The warping is so bad if I hold a board along one side of the table, it does not even get bit by a 1/8" roundover bit. Quite worthless. However, I have taken the legs, switch, and router mount plate to convert a 2" square section of a flat door into a router table. As such I can't return this since I am using some of the parts, but please know this router table is absolute junk.
customer_reviews.author: BP Review

customer_reviews.title: flimsy router table
customer_reviews.text: Instead of buying this, get yourself a makerspace membership for 3 months. They are going to have a proper router table, planer, table saw, drill press, 3d printer, paint shop, etc. I bought this workbench router table about 12 years ago and it's not useful. Kreg table is a bit better. Festool or Incra are top of the line if your budget has no limit.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Starinsky

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Can't Upgrade the Insert Plate. BUY A DIFFERENT ROUTER TABLE!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible router table. The insert plate is of an atypical size, which disallows the use of any upgraded insert plate. Be warned, if you buy this router table, you will be left with a unit that can't be upgraded. It's a garbage design and you'll just end up buying a different router table down the line anyway. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!! Fun fact: Bosch deleted my review off their website; I'm guessing because they don't want people knowing this gigantic flaw in their product. I think people should know this prior to purchasing, as it matters a LOT to the consumer.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Vincent

customer_reviews.title: make sure
customer_reviews.text: Bought table as a present for my son, who has a Dewalt router. According to the product information materials (authored by Bosch), if your router does not fit the original mounting plate, buy an alternative (Bosch RA1186). This plate does not exist and after talking to the small tool customer service; there is no alternative and no substitute. They suggested drilling your own holes in the orignal mounting plate, accommodating the router he has. For now the table is useless and received NO satisfaction from the company. VERY DISAPPOINTED and at this point would suggest looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O.

customer_reviews.title: Bad  manufacturing DO NOT BUY .
customer_reviews.text: Bosch made a big manufacturing mistake. Made an excellent heavy aluminum work top on this bench top router table. Then they added cheap unstable plastic side panel supports. Even though the router was bolted down to the 200 lb bench it caused the cutter blades to make chatter marks on the finished woodwork project. This router table is worthless don't buy it. TO THE MANUFACTURE: I, WOULD HAVE BEEN WILLING TO PAY MORE FOR THE TABLE IF IT WOULD HAVE HAD HEAVY CAST ALUMINUM SUPPORT SIDES. THERE WOULD BE NO CHATTER MARKS. I trusted Bosch, not any more. WAYNE BINGHAM
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Extremely  warped table
customer_reviews.text: Put table together before I realizing the table was very warped. I know the table doesn't have to be perfectly flat to work well, but this table is absolute garbage. Seems like they used a hand held angle grinder to surface it. There's an 1/8 gap at the center when I put straight edge end to end length wise. The mounting plate is straight, but the table itself is warped. I really don't like this table.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H

customer_reviews.title: Do your research, and purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this table for a while now I purchased it in November of 2016. I would never purchase it again. It is difficult to use; the adjustment screws loosen up while the router is on. No matter how tight I make the fence screws they back off and ruin my work. My recommendation look at other manufacturers router tables or purchase extra wood for your projects, you're going to need it. (I'm using a Bosch Router it works flawlessly).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit the router listed on the manual!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed in this purchase! I specifically researched all I needed for this to fit with the existing router I have (and it’s on the list in the manual) and it doesn’t fit!! So inconvenient! Only way to make it fit is to drill the plate and I do not have the equiptment to do so. What a crap! Not only that but I can’t find the extra plate that probably doesn’t fit anyway. I’d like to send it back! Without taking the whole dam thing apart!
customer_reviews.author: amy roberts

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit router ... beware
customer_reviews.text: Not happy... this is the table recommended for the router I bought and it is the same brand. I get it and try to put together, but the router does not fit. It says I need another plate, which apparently Bosch never made! Now I have a useless table!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The table top is the sale point
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am giving this router table 5 stars is for the aluminum top alone. the base is a fiber reinforced plastic of some sort and the fence while being decent is mdf faced. pairing it with the bosch 1617 router is very convenient as the router plate has a pass through that allows you to make height adjustments from up top. I took another reviewers recommendation and mounted it to the dewalt mobile saw base and it is really close to the right height and can be wheeled around the shop when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and logical
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was portable and could be put away when not in use not like full sized router tables that would take up allot of room in my 14 x 17 work shop. It went together easily and the instructions were fairly good. I do have some extra hardware that doesn't show up anywhere in the instructions but all the assembly hardware was there so I'm not worried. I've not used the router table yet but I do have my Milwaukee Routing installed and it runs as expected. If you've got a small work shop and everything has to pull double duty this should work well.
customer_reviews.author: deddy

customer_reviews.title: The mounting plate is a bear to balance.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought a different router table. The mounting plate is very difficult to level on the table because it's not level itself, and having to adjust 8 points on the tables must of been thought up by an engineer on LSD. After trying to level it for a half day, I finally settled for close enough. The table surface itself is sticky, and it's probably not level either. The plastic insert plates aren't level with the table. The electrical switch with lock out capabilities is nice, but getting your router plugged into it is burdensome. The table is okay for simple every day routing, but if you want precision for any degree of fine work, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Davison

customer_reviews.title: good router table
customer_reviews.text: I read many of the reviews, good and bad, and decided to take a chance on this Bosch benchtop router table. I'm glad I did. Found none of the issues others have complained about. Table is flat, my DeWalt router fit well, everything works, assembled it yesterday and used it today on maybe 40 feet of dados. No problems. No complaints. Mounted it on a piece of 3/4 plywood bolted to the top of a spare water heater stand. Paste wax helped reduce friction between the boards and the table. I'm an experienced woodworker for the past almost 50 years, about 10 of it for a paycheck, now as a hobby.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer #1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit for my delta 36-725
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the table for the top it fit perfectly into my Delta 36 - 725 table saw. Placed it in next to the plate that comes with the table saw level that and marked out 12 screw mounts. Purchased Allen head screws And nylon lock nuts. Drilled holes in the rails and the Gray extension plate level everything up tighten the bolts perfect fit works great. Attached fixed dewalt dw618 router. Used 1500 wet dry sand paper and gun oil with palm sander gave a nice smooth surface to the table top
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for a bench top
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works pretty well. The accessories like the fence and plastic safety items have a "not so friendly" way of attaching. By that I mean if you have to remove the fence, you have to remove the bolts. It doesn't take any tools, it's just a pain because you have to keep track of loose parts and you need access to top and bottom to put them back on. Would have been better with a captured nut and threading from the top side. The router plate take some fiddling to get level but it's not too bad. For the money, I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: pythan

customer_reviews.title: Lightning Sale knock out
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd table I’ve bought under the lightning sale price and the 2nd one to be sent back. Both times opened box and checked top with a straight edge. Both rocked bad. Followed another reviews advice and ordered 3rd one from home depot. Opened box, table top near perfect. Took that one home. Doesn’t matter how much money you save on sale, if it’s not right, it’s not right. They must have received a bad batch from China and tried to unload them in the lightning sale. This time lightning struck twice.
customer_reviews.author: Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for the person that does it at home at home, but I would not recommend it for a professional. Make plans to put this item together and leave yourself plenty of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: If you need a lift, this is not your table.
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this would be ideal for my small shop. I mounted it on a table and started using it. I needed to adjust the cutting height on a regular basis and so I bought the Bosch lift. I discovered quickly that the Bosch lift was a mistake and the odd sized router plate prohibits the use of an accurate router lift. Now, I use this router table for operations that do not require accurate setups like rounding edges on small projects.
customer_reviews.author: ACustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great table fits perfectly between the fences of my tablesaw
customer_reviews.text: Used the table of this system with the electronics and mounted it between the fences of my table saw to extend it. Works great and consolidates two tools into one that usually take up a pretty good mount of space otherwise. the mount and quick adjustment screw make this a great system to use and the fence for the router is really really solid. makes using it a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Grimrivet

customer_reviews.title: It’s just the worst.
customer_reviews.text: Just the worst.....from the assembly instructions to design decisions. Any time you want to remove a part you are at risck of loosing things because the damn thing doesn’t stay assembled. All the parts stay on so long as you hold tension to it. Need to losen the fence...the damn thing falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: Odyth

customer_reviews.title: The accuracy of a plastic fork
customer_reviews.text: Id give this zero stars. The fence is a pile of garbage. Even with shims, the mdf planks never align. The whole fence wobbles once you set your distance on one side as you tighten the screws. Absolute garbage. Id return it, if i could.
customer_reviews.author: D.G.Hofstee

customer_reviews.title: New item are supposed to new!
customer_reviews.text: My table works as it should, However Amazon buyers please be careful, the box look new and everything okay but I know this table was used before, table top is scratch, hardware not complete, fence scratches and fingerprints everywhere. I am keep it the table because I need it and it works fine. But I pay for a NEW item when it’s not!!! Careful!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility Issue
customer_reviews.text: The marketing information says it is compatible with Ryobi routers and even lists the compatible models in the manual. The truth is that the table is not compatible with any Ryobi router. The customer service/technical support group suggested I drill holes in the aluminum plate to match my router. That is crazy. Further, none of the screws provided fit any of the holes on my router, R163. Very disappointing. I either have to disassemble the table and return it or buy a new router. Very poor customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I write this without having used the table as yet ...
customer_reviews.text: I write this without having used the table as yet. That said, it took my five hours to put together, and there were bolts missing from the package which require me to look through my gear to find something that would fit. Also, one of the table inserts (the one inch) is completely warped and totally unusable. The directions are okay, but still, in some cases hard to decipher. This table is surprisingly heavy, and well made, and I'm looking forward to using it in my small shop. (Four stars due to missing parts and warped insert.)
customer_reviews.author: David C. Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum and aluminum!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I read the product description the first time, it didn't click that the ENTIRE work surface was aluminum...I thought they were just referring to the router plate. The same for the fence...Solid aluminum with sacrificial mdf face plates. I kinda wish there was an option to buy only the top and the fence to install in your own table (and save money on the legs) but this still is a great deal compared to piecing everything together yourself! It was slightly tricky to level the router plate, but that's to be expected with 8 leveling screws. I haven't used this yet and will update once I do.
customer_reviews.author: bjjjcr

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Pretty impressed with this router table for the price. It did require about 1 hour (plus or minus) worth of assembly out of the box. The feather boards are a plus, and quite necessary. I am a carpentry contractor, so I need tools that will hold up over time. It fit my Porter Cable router, no drilling required. I did deem it necessary to attach a plywood base to the legs of the table, they tell you as much in the directions, and they're right, the unit needs it as the unit tends to move when pushing lumber through the unit. So far, so good. I'll update if the unit does not hold up and perform.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Table!
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded to this router table from a BlueHawk brand router/table from Lowes that had broken down after 2 years of use. What a difference! It probably took about an hour to assemble by myself, including attaching the router (purchased separately), and leveling the table surface. So far, I've used it to route the inlay and edges of some picture frames I was making. I was very happy with the speed and precision of the cuts. No more catching uneven edges of the table, or having the router slowly drop during a pass. It made clean, even, cuts - easy & every time.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and canopy be used for quality precision work
customer_reviews.text: Took me a couple of hours to assemble. The instructions are not very clear and there a whole lot of fasteners to figure out what goes where. During the setup realized that the fence was not square to the table top. Tried every thing but could not get the fence to square with the top. Also the top is a bit rough to feel. Returning it back.
customer_reviews.author: bimal

customer_reviews.title: Top not flat, fence not square.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to find that mine, too, had a top that was not flat. The fence, which at first glance looked awesome, was severely out of square. I can overlook the cheapo plastic legs and switch...but the most important things were just way off. Too bad, I really wanted to like this table.
customer_reviews.author: Paulba

customer_reviews.title: Could have easily designed the table to receive any too, by just changing the metal plate..
customer_reviews.text: I just wish the table were collapsible, And BOSCH could have made it easier to install the router..but I di love being able to use the tablet for other devices all I do is change the plate and mount a skill saw or jig BENEATH the deck and away i go.
customer_reviews.author: Larry G.

customer_reviews.title: Had in my Wish List for more than a year.  Must have forgot something...
customer_reviews.text: Can get a better table at Harbor Freight that actually fits decent routers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good for small scale joinery
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Wish the cast plate could be levelled easier. Can't seem to get that perfect adjustment. Ocasionally the fence slips. Just be sure to tighten. Good for small scale jointing, Dados, lock miter. Safety shield is a pain. I use without.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Money unwisely invested
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my new shop so I can build cabinets for my kitchen. It's a Bosch, but it's cheap and has zero accuracy on the fence. I'd have been better off building a router table from scratch, which is what I'm doing now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice table.  A few annoyances
customer_reviews.text: I like this table. It is well set up and easy to use. No problems with accuracy. Only gripe is the screws keep coming loose due to the router vibrations. Recommend using Loctite or other thread-lock when putting together. Bosch really should be including a small tube since the screws come out so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Cheesy & Cheap, a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed at all. First of all it is not even compatible with all Bosch routers. Second, the majority is cheap plastic. Third, the guides are not level and cheesy. Save your money and look at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: OilfieldGuy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Issues
customer_reviews.text: Table and mount plate very rough. I sanded lightly and waxed to reduce drag. Very time consuming to get the mount plate flush and level with table. I discovered the top is so concave that doing routing on any stock longer than the table results in the middle of the piece being untouched by the bit (using 1/8" round over bit) and only the ends being properly. It's a real disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: MrEarle

customer_reviews.title: Mostly cons, some pros
customer_reviews.text: The plate that came with it did not fit the triton router, but i was able to modify it by drilling new holes. The router insert rings are cheaply made and are not level with the router mounting plate. One of the rings is already broken because it’s so cheap. One of the side storage compartments is supposed to stay in place but it doesn’t, so it has to be taped in place. The miter gauge and the feather boards are also cheap and not easy to install. Pros: working surface is large and the fence is well made.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: First impression
customer_reviews.text: Just received and my overall first impression is impressed. This is a fraction of the cost of a hi end full sized table. But the Table size provides plenty of work area and stability. Assembly takes some time, an hour or so, but directions are good. Now I need to figure out a permanent spot for it in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Received USED product despite purchasing new
customer_reviews.text: Received USED product despite purchasing new. I unboxed the router table and was extremely disappointed to not have a new item. I did not agree to pay full price for a used piece of equipment. I have photos to share showing the preexisting wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great table, and perfect fit for the RIGID 4512 table saw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to fit inside the rails of a RIGID 4512 table saw. Table is a perfect fit, and I am building a cabinet to provide additonal support and storage. Bosch makes good products, and insetting it into the table saw rails is making for a very good compact cutting/milling setup for my woodworking. The universal mounting worked very well, and I had no issues mounting a RIOBI router from my old routing table, and getting it set up. I highly recommend this routing table, esp. if looking for one to fit the 4512 like I was, and not being stuck with a proprietary mounting system is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Blackwolf

customer_reviews.title: This one is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I studied and studied to insure I would get the best bang for my buck before I bought another router table instead of building one to meet what I wanted. I had a competitor's table and it was nice; however, this Bosch was what I was trying to come up with all along. I am more than pleased with it. Instead of building a complete cabinet style table, I built a stand so the surface height of my Bosch router table is the same height as my project table and outfield table for my table saw. Wow! I am loving it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Terrible condition
customer_reviews.text: If this is new I would hate to see what the refurbished ones look like. The top was scratched and dinged like it had been used for years. Within 10 minutes of unpacking it I had already processed the return and packed it back up. I’m going to try one more time in the hopes that this one was just a fluke. If not I won’t be buying Bosch anymore.
customer_reviews.author: radioactivefirecracker4

customer_reviews.title: Table works good..
customer_reviews.text: Table works good... A few things I ran into during assembly. One, the mounting plate for the router isn't clearly marked. It was a hassle to line up properly, and I have a Bosch router. My suggestion is to mark the 3 holes with white-out so you can see the bolt pattern, it'll save a alot of hassle. Secondly, the router can be installed two ways on the mounting plate, but only fits one way.... The correct install is the wood handles placed horizontally... Lastly, the small set screws meant to level the surface. Do Not turn then all the way in, you only need about half....
customer_reviews.author: Chris g

customer_reviews.title: Very solid unit for home or hobby
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this table. It easily adapted for my router and it appears it will work with just about any available (but check first). It's rugged, precise, and infinitely adjustable. I don't think it would be suitable for a professional woodworking shop but for someone like me - a home and hobby furniture maker and woodworker - it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McManus

customer_reviews.title: Screws not correct for mounting mrf  23 base
customer_reviews.text: Warning !! if you are putting the fixed base under a Bosch RA1181 router table the M4 x 20 screws the instructions call for will not work in the blind hole. You must use a shorter screw there as per Bosch tec support.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product except for the miter channel - on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product except for the miter channel - on the example I got the channel was not uniform in width and even though I got an adjustable miter guide, I could not adjust it wide enough to fit snugly in the channel. The metal table is great, but does not conform with my expectations of Bosch precision. When I called customer service, they basically told me that what I got is the way it is and blamed the miter guide. But in fact, the channel varies in width across the table and is uniformly about a 32d wider than 3/4, which allows the guide to wobble.
customer_reviews.author: bk california

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this simply because the sale price on Amazon was expiring and was too good to pass up. My expectations were low. Didn't think I would have a lot of use for a bench top router table. I was surprised and impressed with the build quality. The table's surface area is much bigger than I expected. The table top and the fence are solid and well build. I expect them to last a very long time. I recommend this to beginners and serious woodworkers alike.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Houghton

customer_reviews.title: I started to buy a more expensive table from Kreg but after seeing the features this table has I think it will serve me just fin
customer_reviews.text: Received this and put it together in an hour or two. Instructions were clear and I had no problems. I started to buy a more expensive table from Kreg but after seeing the features this table has I think it will serve me just fine. My Dewalt 618 router mounted with no issues. The router is easily accessed for height adjustments and bit changes. The fence is easily adjusted or removed and came with shims for jointing. I can't wait to use this table....it seems to be of good quality but I will update if any issues occur.
customer_reviews.author: Jordi

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough to use
customer_reviews.text: I gave this the drop test from the back of a 4 wheeler onto a concrete floor. Not a scratch! Easy enough to use. I guess if I was a serious woodworker I'd get a shaper, but I can handle a bit of clunkiness for the price. But, if I was a serious woodworker I wouldn't be storing it on my 4 wheeler. The table is bigger than I expected. The feather boards and guard are a little difficult to move around.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Not horribly bad.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic base is kind of flimsy and the switch mount flexes when you hit it to turn off the router. The biggest issue is the miter gauge slot in the bottom is .79" wide (instead of .75) which makes it very sloppy for both of my miter gauges. Also, the fixed positions in the base for the feather board is not very flexible but serviceable, or course my feather board that fits in a (standard) miter slot will not tighten because the slot it too wide. Also, the safety guard is always in the way so it had to come off during the first use. The top and fence are well built.
customer_reviews.author: Insufficient Funds

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this table thinking the metal would be a more stable choice. Main fixed table is warped. Insert was warped. Used it to make raised panels. When sliding across the table finish side down you will get gouges in the wood from the table. I do not have the lesser expensive table they make, but I wish I had gone with it instead.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Glimpshire

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it seemed to do a good job. I had 80-some blocks of plastic to round the edges of. With the DW618 router I bought for it I was able to zip through all 880+ edges in no time. The table has an abundance of holes to match different brands of routers. There are so many holes that they can become 'pot holes' and make the material being worked on hang up, especially if the pieces are small. My plastic blocks were 1"x2"x3" -- small. I might try filling some of them in with bondo or something to make the surface smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G.

customer_reviews.title: It seemed like it was specifically designed for this application
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed ,I installed it on my rigid 4512 saw . It seemed like it was specifically designed for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastically simple and very accurately - excellent purchase and I’ll be using my router much more often with this very versatile table.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect - a miter gauge would have done it for me
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to give it 5 stars..... It is a very nicely built table and holds my ancient Craftsman router perfectly. Comes with a zillion screws etc to hold different routers and configure the fence and featherboards. My gripe is that it doesn't have a miter gauge - though it has a slot for one, and to add insult to injury, the miter gauge from my beloved Bosch contractors table saw WON'T FIT the slot. Hmmm - Router Table engineer doesn't talk to Table Saw engineer at Bosch???
customer_reviews.author: Consumer of All Things

customer_reviews.title: I give up
customer_reviews.text: Not for novice ! I’m pretty handy but putting this together was a challenge. Only one video on you tube helped even a little bit. One guy used a grinder to level the mounting plate ... I get it !!!! Giving it to my kid... sooo over this project !
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Edwards

customer_reviews.title: So happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome router table. Great results. The 2 complaints I have are: 1) there are far too many screws in the bag, and it isn't very clear which ones are which. Sure, you can figure it out, but it could be packaged or detailed more nicely. 2) Leveling the top is incredibly annoying. There MUST be a better way to do it. Using 8 screws to level the top isn't the best way to do it. I'd hope they could figure out something better.
customer_reviews.author: werned

customer_reviews.title: A decent router table
customer_reviews.text: It is fairly sturdy and it is big enough for a basic benchtop router table. With careful attention, you can get everything square. The casting and CNC work on the table surface is a little sloppy, but does appear to be flat for the most part. The biggest disappointment here though, is while some (not all) of the accessories are made in Germany, the table proper, sigh, just like the 1617EVSPK, is made in China. I like the fact that Amazon pricing on Bosch is attractive, if only companies like Bosch would realize though, that folks are willing to spend more on a product NOT made in China. Swiss and German manufacture has the reputation it does for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Bif McSeriousCat

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall
customer_reviews.text: I think this table is more accurate than me. However the legs are made of cheap plastic as well as the front of the tool. It doesn't inspire confidence when the power switch has so much movement when actuated. however, the table top itself is steel and well made in my opinion. The amount of additional options is good to have as well.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these last year for our shop and used it some and liked it ok. In May we had a fire and lost all of our tools so be are still replacing them. I reordered this table and reordered the Bosch router and have added the Incra box joint miter piece for making box joints. All are working great so far. I have ordered the Incra miter bar as well as I needed it several times now for cutting slots.
customer_reviews.author: G. Richard Schlueter

customer_reviews.title: Pitiful quality
customer_reviews.text: The power switch burned out after cutting a single board the very first day I used this machine. Now I’m having to order a new one from a different company. Pitiful quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Standard Bosch Quality
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a professional router table, but like the Bosch 4100 table saw it is an excellent DIY tool that will handle 95% of your projects and has thoughtful accessories that are included (feather boards, a miter slot in the fence, multiple openings, etc). My table was flat, so apparently that was a production issue. Assembly wasn't terribly difficult. Getting the router base insert level was the hardest (make sure you completely tighten the leveling screws before inserting). So far I've used the table extensively for raised panel doors and planing wood. It gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Armi

customer_reviews.title: It's ok...what other choices do you really have?
customer_reviews.text: As with most tables/jigs, it sucks to spend so much money for something that isn't the actual tool, however this little guy is a necessity for using a router if you're like me and not an expert. For the money I wish there was less plastic, but It works well. My biggest complaint would be that adjusting the fence is pretty tough...as it arrived the two boards did not align so I had to stuff some paper behind one of them. I realize there are work arounds for everything, but I don't think you should have to adjust something that's supposed to be straight.
customer_reviews.author: smcfarla

customer_reviews.title: Decent table for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great value IMO for a pretty solid router table. Well designed and I like the aluminum table compared to other competitors with MDF constriction. Took my Bosch router no problem with mounting plus the ability to raise and lower from the top side thanks to my Bosch routers base design and the tables accommodation to use the height adjusting tool is a big plus. Fence adjustment and design are fine. Meets all my expectations for this price point!
customer_reviews.author: Greg's review

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased product three weeks ago. Had some time today to set it up. When I went to open the package it was clear the glue had been broken before. When I pulled out the table from the package the unit was clearly used before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Switch never worked
customer_reviews.text: After assembling the brand new table I realized that the switch was not doing anything, not working, dead. There is no visible way to complain or get a replacement part. The only option is to disassemble the entire thing , send back and buy it again. BOSCH / amazon is there a way to get a new switch?
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: My first table so nothing to compare it to. All in all I like it. Not without issue though. The fence is terrible. Fully tightened on both sides, the left side sticks out a bit more than right. When passing wood through the but, it gets hung up on the left side of fence. The other issue might be my fault. I have a Bosch mrc router, which is supposed to be able to adjust router height (depth) from the top of table. It turns just fine but doesn't seem to do anything. I understand it's for micro adjustments but I've turned completely in both directions. I still like the table.
customer_reviews.author: B.N.

customer_reviews.title: Best router table for under $500
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a good router table that wasn’t 90% particleboard and under $500. This table is built very well with a very solid aluminum top and fence. My only concern is the plastic legs as in the past tools with this rigid plastic snapped after a few years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Heather  hall

customer_reviews.title: Great table can't go wrong in buying this
customer_reviews.text: very nice table has mounting holes for just about every router but I had to add one extra hole in the table. I mounted my RIDGID router to the table and my adjustment screw for the router tool bit I could not fine a hole to line up with. So I added a new hole so I could adjust my router bit. Besides that works very well for the price you really can't beat it it 's got a bigger work table then most, table top is aluminum not some piece of plastic or fiber board Has most of the attachments you need to do alot. Great table can't go wrong in buying this
customer_reviews.author: William C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality sturdy table.  Easy to assemble.  Levels quickly.  Very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: The Bosch Benchtop router table is a great table for the price. It's a real solid piece of equipment. Works wonderfully and is easily tucked away when not in use. If you have a small shop like mine but want a solid router table, then the Bosch is for you. I've read reviews stating it's hard to put together and level. I have no idea what they're saying. Directions were clear. Router install easily and table levels within minutes. Super happy with my purchase. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Crafter

customer_reviews.title: New? Scratched up out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The table is scratched up out of the box, wondering if I got a refurbished or if Bosch has lost sight of its normally great quality control. Otherwise seems to be as expected.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.text: This table has been great for our woodworking projects. It was easy to put together and simple to move around our workshop as needed. We use ours with a Hitachi router. The table surface is nice and flat, and I love that a vacuum can be attached to the table, which makes routing much easier. We've noticed that after a lot of use, occasionally a bolt will drop out from the bottom (from the vibrations). I think a little loctite or bolt tape would fix this problem, although it would make the table hard to disassemble down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well built, but limited
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. The only difficulty is that the router plate is predrilled for only a short list of routers which I did not see posted on the ad page. I then found out that half of these routers were out of production. In the end I chose the router based on what fit the table, a very small selection, rather than the router that fit my needs. In the end a router table is a pretty simple tool one main purpose and this table accomplishes that purpose very well. Sturdy, good surface work area, well built, light weight. If you are looking at a router table, try to find the list of routers it supports.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C

customer_reviews.title: once assembled was sturdy and worked as anticipated
customer_reviews.text: This table works well but it was a beast to put together. The instructions were fairly unreadable for someone who doesn't already know how to put the thing together. It took a long time to assemble. The inserts on the sides to wrap the cord and for storage, are flimsy and continually fall out. However, otherwise the table, once assembled was sturdy and worked as anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: no

customer_reviews.title: but have to say this may be one of the best purchases I have made in awhile
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews often, but have to say this may be one of the best purchases I have made in awhile. Was considering several, including the other Bosch table, but the quality of this table FAR exceeds all that I know on the market. Start with the base, and concern that it is constructed of plastic, not to worry, very stout. The table and fence are aluminum, and machined. The router insert is heavy aluminum, with eight screws for plane adjustment with the table, although this requires some patience to get precise, will support any heavy router. Assembly took a while, but the instructions (included) were very consise, and well ilustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Y.

customer_reviews.title: The biggest con is the router mounting plate's inability to ...
customer_reviews.text: The biggest con is the router mounting plate's inability to fit 80% of the routers on the market and for those unfortunate older model router owners you will not have the ability to use your router without modifying the mounting plate. I have a black & decker and none of the holes lined up, however, I work for a college that has a computerized machining program and I was able to borrow a cutter bit and I drilled holes to match my bolt circle pattern. This is the only problem I encountered. Once this was resolved I have been using the daylight our of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nothing is assembled, lots of parts...
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality, dislike that you can't just attach your router and use it.... Definatly assembly required and for the price they could at least assemble part of it, like Lowes and their Kobalt router table.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to set up, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Solid router table. Takes a little time to set up correctly, mainly the plate gave me some trouble because you need to mount these washers below the plate in order to have access to adjust the level. I had a hole in a piece of plywood as my previous "router table" and I'm happy with the upgrade
customer_reviews.author: Mth44

customer_reviews.title: Good table
customer_reviews.text: This table has one flaw and that's the plastic inserts that go around the cutter. This plastic inserts sits below the table by .015 making it easy to have your cutter dig into your work. It also creates a step that your work has to climb over as it passes by the cutter. I had to shim mine so it would sit flush which works much better now. Be on the lookout for this if you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Definitely needs to be attached to a workbench in order to stay still enough to accurately route anything. Otherwise, it'll get squirrely on you and mess up your piece. I found this to be true even while using the feather boards. Overall, I expected a bit more quality for the price, especially from bosch. I have a bosch router that I have been very impressed with. The key keeps falling out on its own, and it takes a long time to set up and adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Houeytan

customer_reviews.title: WARPED BASEPLATE
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t want to believe the other reviews so purchased this... don’t make the same mistake I did. Very disappointed in Bosch, given my baseplate was also warped, and I couldn’t get the thing level. Based upon prior reviews, it seems this issued has persisted for years without correction by Bosch. Lost some of my faith in this company. Just use MDF if you can’t manufacture a level baseplate!! Will be returning the product and looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had no trouble mounting my Bosch router but make sure the fine adjustment screw is still accessible from the top of ...
customer_reviews.text: Thank you to whoever made the dimensions fit perfectly inside the fence rails of an R4512 table saw. I use mine as a router table and a table saw extension. I had no trouble mounting my Bosch router but make sure the fine adjustment screw is still accessible from the top of the table. I love that the switch has two outlets which lets me use the second for dust collection.
customer_reviews.author: TravisK

customer_reviews.title: Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: This stupid thing came in 500 pieces, doesn’t even fit my router, and the plate is warped. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but not the worst...
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad table for the price, easy to assemble and a nice fence. Do not purchase if you expect a 3/4" mitre slot- there is 1/16" of slop when i use my machined 3/4" mitre bar. The table and mounting plate I received were both slightly warped and it was a struggle to get them even close to acceptable for precise work. If you are looking for precision right out of the box I would suggest looking at higher priced tables.
customer_reviews.author: Maine_Pumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Solid Router Table
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the benchtop version - This is my first router table but it works well near as i can tell. several nice features including the guides, shields, adjustability. only grip is that it takes quite awhile to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: »ßålåñçæ«

customer_reviews.title: but I love almost everything about this table
customer_reviews.text: Larger than I expected, but I love almost everything about this table. It would be nice if there was some bit storage in the legs. That would be tremendously useful. The only other issue, is my adapter to a 4" dust collector will not fit on the dust port because it is too low to the table. I use a bungee cord between the two feather boards to hold the dust collection close to the port. It works sufficiently for now. This is why I knocked it down one start. My benchdog router top that attaches to my table saw does not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: othervoice

customer_reviews.title: Very solid table
customer_reviews.text: Went through tons of reviews for all router tables on the market, and choose ultimately this one, great choice! Very serious and solid table. The accessories are more little gadgets that I don't think I will use as it's slower to put them in position than just doing the work. I love the double outlet included for the vacuum and the router, starts both at the same time. I use it with a dewalt router, fits perfectly and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Fabien C.

customer_reviews.title: top quality
customer_reviews.text: nice quality parts was a pain to level plate but very pleased overall
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile
customer_reviews.text: This small table top router does everything i need. Construction is good and features are well thought out. Mates well with the Bosch 1617EVSPK 12 Amp 2-1/4-Horsepower Plunge and Fixed Base Variable Speed Router Kit. I recommend the Bosch RA1165 Under-Table Router Base with Above-Table Hex Key it's basically a duplicate fixed base but it has the same quick release so the motor can be removed without having to unscrew the base from the table. The out feed fence shims are useful and the power switch has two outlets one for the router and one for the shop vac. Nice for a small table.
customer_reviews.author: curtatparadox

customer_reviews.title: great router horrible table
customer_reviews.text: router is solid. no question. the table however for the money is lacking. the hardware that holds the router to the table broke on day one and i had to replace most of the screws with my own.
customer_reviews.author: patriot

customer_reviews.title: Like tons of unlabeled parts and fasteners?
customer_reviews.text: If you answered yes to my "headline" then have fun!
customer_reviews.author: grover R.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good easy to assemble table
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I added it to my 6x 8 wood working table and put my router into it so I don’t have to hold it. I am a 70 yr old crafting lady who loves to work with wood but doesn’t have the strength to hold the router anymore . This table is sturdy. Easy to assemble . My son even likes it. He may get one too.
customer_reviews.author: colleen Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Great Table
customer_reviews.text: Great router table. Works perfect! Has a gazillion guides that get a little cumbersome to move or take off. Also not enough storage to put them somewhere when not using them. But at least they give you all the options. The only I wish it came with is a guide that runs along in the track. Luckily I had one from an old table so I use that.
customer_reviews.author: Iguana

customer_reviews.title: Very nice table top router table
customer_reviews.text: Replace an old 30 yr old router and table. This table is very well build and easy to use. Nice guides and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Router table and mounting plate are not flat
customer_reviews.text: This table isn't close to being flat. I used a straight edge and feeler gauges to test how flat the table was before installing the mounting late and found that it is bowed up in the middle and drops down towards the front of the table. The mounting plate is also warped. I gave up after getting the router mounting plate "close enough", but I am tempted to take it to a machine shop to have milled flat. Bosch should have done a much better job with this.
customer_reviews.author: DLCR

customer_reviews.title: lots of features
customer_reviews.text: if your not a pro cabinet shop this little workhorse is the way to go. For the money it can do most anything for a project hobbyist. Lightweight and easy to move around and store.
customer_reviews.author: Baron Von Nobzez

customer_reviews.title: Table saw add on
customer_reviews.text: Great for mounting on my table saw (delta). Perfect fit 27”
customer_reviews.author: NCCHAR

customer_reviews.title: Overall very good for the price and serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: Overall very good for the price and serves it's purpose. The only draw back during assembly is the screws used to level the plate. There are 8 screws underneath the center metal plate, and when trying to follow the instruction and screw them into the nuts, the thread is so tight that if you do this by hand, it would easily strip the screw head (hex). I ended up holding the nut with a plier and used impact driver to drive in the screws. Other than this, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dz1979

product_meta.title: Bosch Benchtop Router Table RA1181
product_meta.description:
The Bosch RA1181 bench top router table provides a large work surface for woodworking and routing. Designed to fit a variety of routers, this router table is a versatile piece of equipment that will serve as an indispensable part of any woodworking shop. Its 2 1/2 inch dust collection port offers better dust collection for a cleaner work environment. The large aluminum top makes the table both durable and portable. This bench top router table includes mounting hardware, features a tall aluminum fence with adjustable MDF face plates, two out feed shims, and an aluminum router mounting plate. The starter pin and guard for router curved work pieces is also included, in addition to the built in cord wrap for convenient storage and portability. 

Works with: 

Bosch: 1613-Series and 1619EVS Plunge Routers; 1617-Series and MRF-Series Routers (in fixed base only)
Craftsman: Most Craftsman 1/2"-Collet Routers
DeWalt: DW616 and DW618 Routers (in fixed base only)
Hitachi: M12VC Routers
Makita: RF1100 and RF1101 Routers
Milwaukee: 5615 and 5616 Routers
Porter-Cable: 690-Series and 892-895-Series Routers (in fixed bases only) and 7529 Plunge Router
Ryobi: R161, R162, R163, RE170 and RE180 PL Routers
Skil: 1810, 1815, 1820 and 1825 Routers
Template Guides: The RA1181 does not accept any template guides.
Vacuum Hoses: Common 2-1/2" 
Vacuum Hoses attach directly to the RA1181.
Vacuum Hose Adapter for 35 mm Hoses, such as Bosch 35 Hoses: VAC004.
feature_bullets: Benchtop router table design – features a large aluminum top for extended work area, durability and precision
Rigid aluminum mounting plate – pre-drilled for compatibility with a variety of routers and for above-table height adjustment
Extra tall aluminum fence – has adjustable faceplates and featherboards to maximize precision and versatility
Dedicated standard dust-collection port – fits standard 2-1/2 In. vacuum hoses for debris-free operation to help keep your work area clean
Easy-to-use adjustable featherboards – attach to fence and table, providing additional guidance and kickback protection
Accessory slot – accepts featherboards and 3/4 In. optional accessories such as a miter gauge
Storage pocket – allows storage of router accessories
Cord-wrap storage – stores 6 Ft. power cord

specifications.Warranty Description: 30 day money back guarantee, 1 yr limited warranty, 1 yr service protection plan
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,441 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
